intro: Luisia pulniana, commonly known as the silverleaf luisia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Luisia pulniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, rocky soils.
